intro: Borreria diffusa, commonly known as Mexican heather, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Borreria diffusa has small, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
